content.description:
As you would expect the crux is at the roof, with an exposed traverse to the left to buckets.

The first bolt is quite low in a dish, near the middle
10 bolts, fixed anchor

This rig is rad- a boulder crux down low (bolts 3-4) with two options, and a redpoint crux turning the lip of the big roof up top! 

Climb easy terrain to a ledge where you stand and clip bolt 3, from here your objective is to gain a hand rail from which you can clip bolt 4. If you pass bolt 3 on the left you have chosen crimp and sloper at ~5.11+, if you pass bolt 3 on the right, you have chosen wisely (~5.11b: launch from a decent rail to a bucket and hand traverse carefully back left). After bolt four there is one more slightly cryptic move before climbing several feet of easy terrain to gain a no hands rest under the roof. Rest up and turn the roof on good holds, but, pray that someone has ticked the "Thank-God" hold well up and to the right of the final bolt. If you're going ground up, probably easiest to clip the last bolt when it's at your thigh (safe fall), if the draw is already there, you can easily clip it before turning the roof.

Long-draw your last 3 bolts (below the roof, on the roof and above the roof).

Look for the biggest roof on the wall with a distinctive "nose" block under the roof. 
8 bolts (?), 2 bolt anchor with biners

Easy climbing brings you to the 3rd bolt (on the roof), give a ceremonial shake, chalk up, and fire the powerful boulder problem clipping the 4th (last) bolt in the process. Turn out of the overhang and finish the easy/dirty slab to an anchor composed of one rusty hook, and one bolt with a quick link.

If the 4th draw is already hanging you can traverse left under the roof, reach up and clip, then retreat to your resting position before taking on the boulder problem.

Far left (west) of the Croissant Wall. 
4 bolts, 1 bolt/1 hook anchor

Start up a giant flake (5.10) which breaks to an easier low angle section. Another 5.10 section leads you to a rest below the money section of the climb- the tightly bolted overhang. Creative footwork helps you through good but painful holds to a slightly run-out glory bucket slam to the chains (no biners). 

Do not extend the 3rd bolt, extend bolts 4-roof. 

Look for the flake down low and tightly bolted overhanging rounded-arete feature; towards the right side of the wall. 
9 bolts, +2 draws for the anchors.

Start through easy black rock straight up to a high but safe first bolt. Climb a few feet to the second "free" bolt, and then it's business. A series of beautiful mini-boulders are protected by bolts 3 and 4 over 3 mini-bulge/roof sections, with clipping bolt 5 marking the end of the low crux. The route eases off with a no hands rest on the ledge, after which you are once again greeted by a series of mini-boulders; unlike below, these ones are separated by good rests. Finally, turn the intimidating roof which is a glorious bucket slam going no harder than 5.10, and stand on the ledge to clip the chains. 

Long draw bolt 1, 5 (just below the midway ledge, after the first roof), 9 (below the top roof) and 10 (top roof).

Bolt line going up the right side of the black rock- look for the distinctive low and high roof features. 
10 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

Reachy moves through the crux. Big holds, big overhang

5th bolt line from the left- this line passes just left of the big roof.
9 bolts, fixed anchor

Face climbing on featured slab, questionable finish. Scramble over blocks to anchor.

Right of Rocky Mountain Fever
3 bolts

Same shared low first bolt as 51 Hot Dogs, but traverses to the right under bolt 2 (do not clip).
***Guide books says to traverse after the 5th bolt***

Head up easy and fun climbing before things get more serious for a couple of bolts below the roof. One final rest (with an optional but not overly useful hand jam), and then heel hook/hand traverse back left on the roof before heading up and right past one last bolt to the chains. There's no single hard move, just a big, pumpy roof!

Have your belayer un-clip your first bolt after you're past it being useful. Can back clean bolt 2 if you want.

Look for the big roof, the first line that skirts the roof to the right is "51 Hot Dogs", this line is to the right of that, and shares the same, low first bolt (~2.5 off the deck).
9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners.

Anchor is hidden in an alcove

Just below Gomer wall, this is the route to the left of the short 5.8. 
6 bolts, fixed anchor with chains

Climb up 4 bolts to a rest before a bulge, pull the bulge trending up and right to clip a chain, traverse farther right under the roof (possible pump crux here), and then head straight up through 2 roofs passing several bolts on your way to the anchor.

Back-clean or un-clip bolt 2 once you have clipped bolt 3, long draw bolt 4. It's easiest to clean the bottom 4 draws off this route by climbing the left variation after.

Second bolt-line from the left, right-hand branch. Look for the chain at bolt 5.
8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

Start by traversing in from the right up a ramp in black rock. The bolt line is straight up from a bolt with no hanger ~2m off the ground. Grab your first couple of high but safe clips, then boulder on poor rock from bolts 2-4; bolt 3 is difficult to hang/clip, but is feasible with a mean drop knee. 

Another boulder problem guards the roof; the daunting roof is easier than it looks from below, but unfortunately ends in a messy mantle top out into dirt. 

Look for the a giant hueco in the roof up top, this bolt line passes within a couple feet of this feature! You can also spot the shiny bolt with no hanger a couple meters off the deck. 
9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

A slightly reachy move gets you onto the wall where you are immediately met with serious climbing- in contrast to several of the other routes on the wall. Clip bolt 3 from a great blocky hold over your head (or a slightly lower, sometimes water filled pocket) and then boulder through a short sequence to clip your 4th bolt and return to easier territory. A redpoint crux awaits you up higher!

Third bolt-line from the left, look for a black water streak in white rock below the low roof. 
9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

Climb buckets, until the section between the 4th and 5th bolts where sadly there are no buckets. But, have no fear, use a crimp to regain more buckets and then pull the roof on massive holds!

Look for the line that goes up the roof on the right side of croissant wall, starts between a couple of stands of trees right up against the wall. 
8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor (no biners)

Climb the first 4 bolts of "See the Light" and then branch left, pulling the crux move up into the dihedral just after the 4th bolt. Clip awkwardly over your head, turn the roof and continue up to the anchor. Watch your footing, dirty rock!

Starts up the second bolt line from the left of the wall, branches left after bolt 4 of "See the Light" - the 5th bolt on see the light has a chain extension on it.
6 bolts, 1 bolt with biner/1 hook anchor

There is a crux waiting for you at the top

Third bolt line from the left. Look for a mega block down low and a finger seam mid wall (bolt 6).
9 bolts, anchor with biners (shared with Strange Currency)
Named for its shape and flakiness, it is a must-do
